data.chText: 直接
data.enText: nobody/nothing in between

data.chText: 直接的；亲自的；亲身的
data.enText: happening or done without involving other people, actions, etc. in between

data.chText: 他们与劫机者直接联系。
data.enText: They are in direct contact with the hijackers.

data.chText: 他的死是你的行为直接造成的后果。
data.enText: His death was a direct result of your action.

data.chText: 我们在寻找对这种工作有过亲身体验的人。
data.enText: We are looking for somebody with direct experience of this type of work.

data.chText: 这一信息与此论据有直接关系。
data.enText: This information has a direct bearing on (= it is closely connected with) the case.

data.chText: 旅程；道路
data.enText: journey/route

data.chText: 笔直的；径直的；最近的
data.enText: going in the straightest line between two places without stopping or changing direction

data.chText: 最直接的路线 / 航线
data.enText: the most direct route/course

data.chText: 直飞航班
data.enText: a direct flight (= a flight that does not stop)

data.chText: 有一班直达利兹的火车。
data.enText: There's a direct train to Leeds (= it may stop at other stations but you do not have to change trains) .

data.chText: 直接命中
data.enText: a direct hit (= a hit that is accurate and does not touch sth else first)

data.chText: 热；光
data.enText: heat/light

data.chText: 直射的
data.enText: with nothing between sth and the source of the heat or light

data.chText: 给孩子搽点防晒霜以防日光直接照射。
data.enText: Protect your child from direct sunlight by using a sunscreen.

data.chText: 恰好
data.enText: exact

data.chText: 正好的；恰好的
data.enText: exact

data.chText: 那与你昨天告诉我的截然相反。
data.enText: That's the direct opposite of what you told me yesterday.

data.chText: 直接引语
data.enText: a direct quote (= one using a person's exact words)

data.chText: 直爽
data.enText: saying what you mean

data.chText: 直爽的；直率的；坦率的
data.enText: saying exactly what you mean in a way that nobody can pretend not to understand

data.chText: 直截了当的回答；坦率的问题
data.enText: a direct answer/question

data.chText: 你得慢慢习惯他这种直率的方式。
data.enText: You'll have to get used to his direct manner.

data.chText: 关系
data.enText: relationship

data.chText: 直系的；嫡系的
data.enText: related through parents and children rather than brothers, sisters, aunts, etc.

data.chText: 国家第一任总统的嫡系后裔
data.enText: a direct descendant of the country's first president

data.chText: 目标
data.enText: aim

data.chText: 把…对准（某方向或某人）
data.enText: to aim sth in a particular direction or at a particular person

data.chText: 这种机器将很强的射线对准身体感染部位。
data.enText: The machine directs a powerful beam at the affected part of the body.

data.chText: 我们需要注意的主要有三个问题。
data.enText: There are three main issues that we need to direct our attention to.

data.chText: 他主要是生自己的气。
data.enText: Most of his anger was directed against himself.

data.chText: 那话是冲着我来的吗？
data.enText: Was that remark directed at me?

data.chText: 控制
data.enText: control

data.chText: 管理；监督；指导
data.enText: to control or be in charge of sb/sth

data.chText: 已任命一位新经理来管理这项工程。
data.enText: A new manager has been appointed to direct the project.

data.chText: 他奉命统率并指挥作战行动。
data.enText: He was asked to take command and direct operations .

data.chText: 电影；戏剧；音乐
data.enText: movie/play/music

data.chText: 导演（戏剧或电影）；指挥（管弦乐队）
data.enText: to be in charge of actors in a play, or a film/movie, or musicians in an orchestra , etc.

data.chText: 她宁愿当演员，不愿当导演。
data.enText: She prefers to act rather than direct.

data.chText: 这部电影是由史蒂文∙斯皮尔伯格导演的。
data.enText: The movie was directed by Steven Spielberg.

data.chText: 她目前担任一个大合唱团的指挥。
data.enText: She now directs a large choir.

data.chText: 指路
data.enText: show the way

data.chText: 给（某人）指路；为（某人）领路
data.enText: to tell or show sb how to get to somewhere or where to go

data.chText: 请问到车站怎么走？
data.enText: Could you direct me to the station?

data.chText: 一名警察在指挥交通。
data.enText: A police officer was directing the traffic.

data.chText: 下达命令
data.enText: give order

data.chText: 指示；命令
data.enText: to give an official order

data.chText: 警察奉命搜查这栋大楼。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The police officers had been directed to search the building.

data.chText: 法官判决孩子由母亲监护。
data.enText: The judge directed that the mother be given custody of the children.

data.chText: 法官判决孩子由母亲监护。
data.enText: The judge directed that the mother should be given custody of the children.

data.chText: 信函；意见
data.enText: letter/comment

data.chText: 把（信件等）寄至；交予
data.enText: to send a letter, etc. to a particular place or to a particular person

data.chText: 将投诉寄至用户服务部。
data.enText: Direct any complaints to the Customer Services department.

data.chText: 旅程；路线
data.enText: journey/route

data.chText: 直接；径直
data.enText: without stopping or changing direction

data.chText: 我们直飞香港。
data.enText: We flew direct to Hong Kong.

data.chText: 10:40这班火车直达利兹。
data.enText: The 10.40 goes direct to Leeds.

data.chText: 亲自
data.enText: nobody in between

data.chText: 亲自；直接
data.enText: without involving other people

data.chText: 我更愿意直接跟他打交道。
data.enText: I prefer to deal with him direct.

data.text: honest ♦ frank ♦ direct ♦ open ♦ outspoken ♦ straight ♦ blunt

data.chText: 以上各词均形容人坦率、坦诚。
data.enText: These words all describe people saying exactly what they mean without trying to hide feelings, opinions or facts.
honest

data.chText: 指坦率的、坦诚的：
data.enText: not hiding the truth about sth

data.chText: 感谢你对我这么坦诚。
data.enText: Thank you for being so honest with me.
frank

data.chText: 指坦率的、直率的（有时可能不讨人喜欢）：
data.enText: honest in what you say, sometimes in a way that other people might not like

data.chText: 坦白说，我认为你的儿子不大可能通过考试。
data.enText: To be frank with you, I think your son has little chance of passing the exam.
direct

data.chText: 指直接的、直率的、坦率的：
data.enText: saying exactly what you mean in a way that nobody can pretend not to understand

data.chText: 你得慢慢习惯他这种直率的方式。
data.enText: You'll have to get used to his direct manner.

data.chText: direct有时被认为含褒义，但有时是以礼貌的方式表示某人有些粗鲁。
data.enText: Being direct is sometimes considered positive but sometimes it is used as a ‘polite’ way of saying that sb is rude.
open

data.chText: 指为人诚恳的、坦诚的、直率的：
data.enText: ( approving ) (of a person) not keeping thoughts and feelings hidden

data.chText: 他对离开的原因完全未加隐瞒。
data.enText: He was quite open about his reasons for leaving.
outspoken

data.chText: 指直率的、坦诚的、直言不讳的：
data.enText: saying exactly what you think, even if this shocks or offends people

data.chText: 她对该计划的批评直言不讳。
data.enText: She was outspoken in her criticism of the plan.
straight

data.chText: 指坦诚的、直率的：
data.enText: honest and direct

data.chText: 我觉得你没跟我坦诚相见。
data.enText: I don't think you're being straight with me.
blunt

data.chText: 指嘴直的、直言不讳的：
data.enText: saying exactly what you think without trying to be polite

data.chText: 她说话出了名的直截了当。
data.enText: She has a reputation for blunt speaking.

data.chText: 词语辨析
honest和frank既指说话方式，也指说话内容：
data.enText: Honest and frank refer to what you say as much as how you say it.

data.chText: 坦承有错
data.enText: an honest/a frank admission of guilt

data.chText: 两词基本上含褒义，尽管有可能过分直率而不讨人喜欢。
data.enText: They are generally positive words, although it is possible to be too frank in a way that other people might not like.

data.chText: direct、outspoken和blunt均指说话直截了当；outspoken暗含说自己认为正确的话而不惜开罪于人；blunt和direct常含认为诚实比礼貌更重要之义；open含褒义，形容人的性格：
data.enText: Direct , outspoken and blunt all describe sb's manner of saying what they think. Outspoken suggests that you are willing to shock people by saying what you believe to be right. Blunt and direct often suggest that you think honesty is more important than being polite. Open is positive and describes sb's character.

data.chText: 我这个人非常坦诚直率。
data.enText: I'm a very open person.
which word?
to be honest/frank/direct/open/outspoken/straight/blunt
honest/frank/direct/open/outspoken/straight about sth
honest/frank/direct/open/straight/blunt with sb
a(n) honest/frank/direct/straight/blunt answer
a(n) frank/direct/open/outspoken/blunt person/manner
quite/very/really/extremely honest/frank/direct/open/outspoken/straight/blunt
rather frank/outspoken
To be/Let's be honest/frank/blunt… (= what I really think is…)

data.chText: 以上各词均含命令、指挥、要求之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to use your position of authority to say to sb that they must do sth.
order

data.chText: 指命令、指挥、要求：
data.enText: to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 公司被勒令向以前的员工作出补偿。
data.enText: The company was ordered to pay compensation to its former employee.

data.chText: “马上过来！”她命令道。
data.enText: ‘Come here at once!’ she ordered.
tell

data.chText: 指命令、指示、吩咐：
data.enText: to say to sb that they must or should do sth

data.chText: 有人吩咐他坐下等着。
data.enText: He was told to sit down and wait.

data.chText: 别对我指手画脚的！
data.enText: Don't tell me what to do!
instruct

data.chText: 尤指以正式或官方的方式指示、命令、吩咐：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to tell sb to do sth, especially in a formal or official way

data.chText: 那封信指示他立即向总部汇报。
data.enText: The letter instructed him to report to headquarters immediately.
direct

data.chText: 指正式发出指示、命令：
data.enText: ( formal ) to give an official order

data.chText: 法官指示陪审团作出无罪裁决。
data.enText: The judge directed the jury to return a verdict of not guilty.
command

data.chText: 指利用权力命令：
data.enText: to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 他命令手下撤退。
data.enText: He commanded his men to retreat.

data.chText: 用order还是command？
order较command通用，可用于任何权威人物命令他人做某事，如父母、老师或政府。command的语气稍强于order，可能暗指有人反对这命令，或如果允许的话，有人会反对。command是部队长官发布命令的一般用词，或者用于发布一般没有商量余地的命令。该词不大可能用于父母或老师。
data.enText: Order is a more general word than command and can be used about anyone in a position of authority, such as a parent, teacher or government telling sb to do sth. Command is slightly stronger than order and can suggest that there is some opposition to the order, or would be if opposition were allowed. It is the normal word to use about an army officer giving orders, or in any context where it is normal to give orders without any discussion about them. It is less likely to be used about a parent or teacher.
order or command?
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb to do sth
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb that…
to order/instruct/direct/command that…
to do sth as ordered/told/instructed/directed/commanded

data.text: take ♦ lead ♦ escort ♦ drive ♦ show ♦ guide ♦ usher ♦ direct

data.chText: 以上各词均含带去、引领之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to go with sb from one place to another.
take

data.chText: 指带去、带路、引领：
data.enText: to go with sb from one place to another, for example in order to show them sth or to show them the way to a place

data.chText: 步行路太远，我开车送你去。
data.enText: It's too far to walk─I'll take you by car.
lead

data.chText: 指带路、领路、引领：
data.enText: to go with or go in front of sb in order to show them the way or to make them go in the right direction

data.chText: 消防队员把幸存者带到了安全的地方。
data.enText: Firefighters led the survivors to safety.
escort

data.chText: 指护卫、护送：
data.enText: to go with sb in order to protect or guard them or to show them the way

data.chText: 总统在十二名保镖的护送下到达。
data.enText: The president arrived, escorted by twelve bodyguards.
drive

data.chText: 指驾车送（人）：
data.enText: to take sb somewhere in a car, taxi, etc.

data.chText: 我母亲开车把我们送到了机场。
data.enText: My mother drove us to the airport.
show

data.chText: 指引领、带领：
data.enText: to take sb to a particular place, in the right direction, or along the correct route

data.chText: 服务员把我们带到我们的座位。
data.enText: The attendant showed us to our seats.
guide

data.chText: 指给某人领路（或导游）、指引：
data.enText: to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them; to show sb a place that you know well

data.chText: 她带领我们穿过了繁忙的街道。
data.enText: She guided us through the busy streets.

data.chText: 我们被领着参观了博物馆。
data.enText: We were guided around the museums.
usher

data.chText: 指礼貌地引往、引导、引领，尤指在建筑物内：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to politely take or show sb where they should go, especially within a building

data.chText: 她把客人引领到座位上。
data.enText: She ushered her guests to their seats.
direct

data.chText: 指给某人指路、为某人领路：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to tell or show sb how to get somewhere or where to go

data.chText: 一名年轻女子给他们指了去车站的路。
data.enText: A young woman directed them to the station.
to take/lead/escort/drive/show/guide/usher/direct sb to/out of/into sth
to take/lead/escort/drive/show/guide sb around/round
to take/lead/escort/drive sb home
to take/lead/escort/guide sb to safety
to lead/show the way

simple_means.memory_skill: di 二 + rect 正，直 → 直接连接两点的 → 直接的

ex.chText: 下一航班直飞巴黎。
ex.enText: The next flight goes direct to Paris.

ex.chText: 他们直接去了医院。
ex.enText: They went direct to the hospital.

synonyms.bx: 指行程途中不停歇、不改变方向，直奔目的地。

ex.chText: 新规则将直接影响到我们。
ex.enText: The new regulation will directly affect us.

ex.chText: 你应该把证据直接提供给警方。
ex.enText: You should provide the evidence directly to the police.

synonyms.bx: 指不经由其他人、动作、过程等而直接起作用。

ex.chText: 我昨天太累了，没脱衣服就直接上床睡觉了。
ex.enText: I was so tired yesterday and went straight to bed without taking off any clothes.

ex.chText: 他讲话时从不直奔主题。
ex.enText: He never gets straight to the point whenever he gives a speech.

synonyms.bx: 强调立即做某事， 中间没有停顿或耽搁。

ex.chText: 他带着我们走过小巷奔向汽车站。
ex.enText: He guided us through a small lane to the bus stop.

ex.chText: 用探照灯引领轮船进港。
ex.enText: Searchlights were used to guide the steamer into the harbour.

ex.chText: 我迷失方向时，你帮助引导我，鼓励我。
ex.enText: When I lose my way, you help guide and cheer me on.

synonyms.bx: 指带领某人至某处，也指为某人或某物引路，引申则指引导某人的行为或观点。

ex.chText: 到达之后，他被带到了司令部。
ex.enText: On arrival, he was conducted to the headquarters.

ex.chText: 导游带我们游览了该国最古老的博物馆。
ex.enText: The guide conducted us around the oldest museum in the country.

synonyms.bx: 指引领某人去某处，或带游客游览。

ex.chText: 你能告诉我到火车站怎么走吗？
ex.enText: Can you direct me to the railway station?

ex.chText: 他请这个小姑娘告诉他怎么去动物园。
ex.enText: He asked the little girl to direct him to the zoo.

synonyms.bx: 指为某人指示方向，但不是亲自带路。

ex.chText: 侍者把我们带到桌边。
ex.enText: The waiter led us to our table.

ex.chText: 向导把我们带到大教堂。
ex.enText: The guide led us to the cathedral.

ex.chText: 旗舰引领着舰队。
ex.enText: The flagship led the fleet.

synonyms.bx: 指引领某人至某处，或走在前面给一群人、动物、车队或船队引路或开道。

ex.chText: 他有管理大型项目的经验吗？
ex.enText: Has he had any experience of managing large projects?

ex.chText: 这家公司经营良好。
ex.enText: The company is well managed.

ex.chText: 他被要求去管理一支足球队。
ex.enText: He was asked to manage a football team.

synonyms.bx: 指管理公司、组织等，通常要为别人的工作负责任。

ex.chText: 他坚持认为这笔资金应该由当地慈善机构管理。
ex.enText: He insisted that the money should be administered by local charities.

ex.chText: 哪个部门管理协会的事务？
ex.enText: Which office administers the affairs of the Society?

ex.chText: 现任政府一直不善于抓经济工作。
ex.enText: The economy has been poorly administered by the present government.

synonyms.bx: 指管理公司、机构、国家等的事务，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 上下班高峰时间将有一名交警来指挥交通。
ex.enText: A traffic policeman will direct the traffic at rush hour.

ex.chText: 苏珊被任命来管理这项工程。
ex.enText: Susan was appointed to direct the project.

synonyms.bx: 指通过组织人或活动对项目等进行管理。

ex.chText: 在英国，君主为国家元首，但不治理国家。
ex.enText: In Britain the sovereign reigns but does not govern.

ex.chText: 她指责反对党不适合治理国事。
ex.enText: She accused the opposition party of being unfit to govern.

synonyms.bx: 指依法治理国家、城市等。

ex.chText: 她期待能得到一些坦率而真实的回答。
ex.enText: She expected to have some plain and truthful answers.

synonyms.bx: 强调坦诚的、如实表达所思所想的。

ex.chText: 说得不客气一点，很多申请人英语水平都不高。
ex.enText: To be blunt, many of the candidates only have a low level of English.

ex.chText: 她唐突的话语大大地伤害了他。
ex.enText: Her blunt words hurt him so much.

synonyms.bx: 强调直言不讳的，即便可能使别人不悦。

ex.chText: 两位领导人的谈话直率而坦诚。
ex.enText: The conversation between the two leaders was direct and candid.

ex.chText: 真是无情的直率评价！
ex.enText: What a brutally candid assessment!

synonyms.bx: 强调直率的，即使事实令人不舒服或尴尬也要直言相告，不加以隐瞒。

ex.chText: 请正面回答我的问题。
ex.enText: Please give me a direct answer.

ex.chText: 她有时觉得她丈夫太率直了。
ex.enText: She sometimes feels that her husband is too direct.

ex.chText: 我们有过坦率的交谈。
ex.enText: We have had a frank talk.

ex.chText: 他对你也许不完全坦诚。
ex.enText: He was perhaps not entirely frank with you.

synonyms.bx: 强调有话直说的，不隐瞒自己的观点、意见等。

ex.chText: 他用枪瞄准了那头野猪。
ex.enText: He pointed his gun at the boar.

ex.chText: 别把相机对准我！
ex.enText: Don't point your camera at me!

synonyms.bx: 泛指用某物对准某物或某人。

ex.chText: 这名士兵只是举枪瞄准，没有射击。
ex.enText: The solider only aimed his gun but did not shoot.

ex.chText: 跳伞员的目标是运动场，却降落在附近的社区里。
ex.enText: The parachuter was aiming at the playground but landed in a nearby community.

synonyms.bx: 指选定射击或动作、行动等的目标，并向其瞄准。

ex.chText: 别动！机器会把X光射线对准你的身体照射。
ex.enText: Stay put! The machine will direct an X-ray beam at your body.

ex.chText: 一条新的道路将把卡车从镇中心疏导开去。
ex.enText: A new road will direct lorries away from the town center.

ex.chText: 老师建议学生们注意看第二段。
ex.enText: The teacher suggested that students direct their attention to paragraph two.

synonyms.bx: 指把具体之物对准某个方向或某人，也可指使抽象之物有所针对。

tr: plan and direct (a complex undertaking)
specifically design a product, event, or activity for a certain public
command with authority
example: He directed the children to do their homework

tr: give directions to
point somebody into a certain direction
example: I directed them towards the town hall

tr: put an address on (an envelope)
intend (something) to move towards a certain goal
example: He aimed his fists towards his opponent's face
direct your anger towards others, not towards yourself

tr: point or cause to go (blows, weapons, or objects such as photographic equipment) towards
example: Please don't aim at your little brother!
He trained his gun on the burglar
Don't train your camera on the women
Take a swipe at one's opponent

tr: guide the actors in (plays and films)
lead, as in the performance of a composition
Barenboim conducted the Chicago symphony for years"
direct the course
determine the direction of travelling
cause to go somewhere
example: The explosion sent the car flying in the air
She sent her children to camp
He directed all his energies into his dissertation

tr: take somebody somewhere
example: We lead him to our chief
can you take me to the main entrance?
He conducted us to the palace

tr: be in charge of
lacking compromising or mitigating elements
exact
direct in spatial dimensions
proceeding without deviation or interruption
straight and short
(of a current) flowing in one direction only
straightforward in means or manner or behavior or language or action
similar in nature or effect or relation to another quantity
example: a term is in direct proportion to another term if it increases (or decreases) as the other increases (or decreases)

tr: moving from west to east on the celestial sphere
or--for planets--around the sun in the same direction as the Earth
having no intervening persons, agents, conditions
example: in direct contact with the voters
the direct cause of the accident

tr: in precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker
in a straight unbroken line of descent from parent to child
example: a direct descendant of the king

tr: being an immediate result or consequence
example: a direct result of the accident

tr: without deviation
example: the path leads directly to the lake

value.def: Direct means moving towards a place or object, without changing direction and without stopping, for example in a journey.

example.ex: They'd come on a direct flight from Athens.
example.tran: 他们是搭乘从雅典直飞这里的航班过来的。

example.ex: ...the direct route from Amman to Bombay.
example.tran: 从安曼到孟买的直达线路

example.ex: You can fly direct to Amsterdam from most British airports.
example.tran: 从英国的大多数机场都可以直飞阿姆斯特丹。

example.ex: The jumbo jet is due to fly the hostages directly back to London.
example.tran: 大型喷气式客机将把人质直接送回伦敦。

value.def: If something is in direct heat or light, it is strongly affected by the heat or light, because there is nothing between it and the source of heat or light to protect it.

example.ex: Medicines should be stored away from direct sunlight...
example.tran: 药品的储放应避免阳光直射。

example.ex: Direct illumination is harsh and unflattering.
example.tran: 直射光照明既刺目又呆板。

value.tran: (光或热)直接照射的，直接接触的

value.def: You use direct to describe an experience, activity, or system which only involves the people, actions, or things that are necessary to make it happen.

example.ex: He has direct experience of the process of privatisation...
example.tran: 他对私有化过程有着切身体会。

example.ex: He seemed to be in direct contact with the Boss...
example.tran: 他似乎直接和老板联系。

example.ex: He is expected to extend direct rule by the central government for another six months.
example.tran: 预计他将把中央政府的直接统治再延长 6 个月。

example.ex: I can deal direct with your Inspector Kimble...
example.tran: 我可以跟你们的金布尔巡官当面交谈。

example.ex: Write to us direct with details of your clubs.
example.tran: 直接给我们写信，讲述一下你们俱乐部的详细情况。

value.tran: (经验、活动或系统)直接的，亲身的

example.ex: We cannot measure pain directly. It can only be estimated...
example.tran: 我们无法直接度量出疼痛的程度，而只能是作出估计。

example.ex: The British could do nothing directly to help the Austrians.
example.tran: 英国无法给奥地利人提供直接援助。

value.def: You use direct to emphasize the closeness of a connection between two things.

example.ex: They were unable to prove that she died as a direct result of his injection...
example.tran: 他们无法证明她的死是由于他的注射直接引起的。

example.ex: His visit is direct evidence of the improvement in their relationship...
example.tran: 他的到访是他们之间关系已有所改善的明证。

example.ex: The minister denied there was a direct connection between the two issues.
example.tran: 部长否认两者之间有直接的联系。

value.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as direct, you mean that they are honest and open, and say exactly what they mean.

example.ex: He avoided giving a direct answer...
example.tran: 他避免作出正面回答。

example.ex: The new songs are more direct...
example.tran: 这些新歌听起来更直入人心。

example.ex: No direct reference was made to the call by the Foreign Office minister.
example.tran: 没有直接提及外交部长的拜访。

value.tran: 坦率的;率直的;直截了当的

example.ex: At your first meeting, explain simply and directly what you hope to achieve...
example.tran: 初次见面时，要单刀直入地指出你想要达到什么目标。

example.ex: But he then went on to refer very directly to the argument.
example.tran: 不过接下来他就直切主题提到了那场争论。

example.ex: Using 'I' adds directness to a piece of writing...
example.tran: 采用第一人称会使文章更显亲切。

example.ex: 'I like Rupert enormously,' she said, with a directness which made Pat flush.
example.tran: “我非常喜欢鲁珀特，”她说道，其坦率让帕特羞红了脸。

value.def: If you direct something at a particular thing, you aim or point it at that thing.

example.ex: I directed the extinguisher at the fire without effect...
example.tran: 我把灭火器对准了火焰，但没起作用。

example.ex: He directed the tiny beam of light at the roof.
example.tran: 他把那一小束光对准了屋顶。

value.def: If your attention, emotions, or actions are directed at a particular person or thing, you are focusing them on that person or thing.

example.ex: The learner's attention needs to be directed to the significant features...
example.tran: 需要将学习者的注意力引向那些着重点上。

example.ex: Do not be surprised if, initially, she directs her anger at you...
example.tran: 如果一上来她就冲你发火，不必惊讶。

example.ex: One assassination attempt was directed against the country's top three government leaders.
example.tran: 有一次未遂的暗杀行动是针对该国的3名最高层领导人而来的。

value.tran: 使(注意力、情感、行为等)转向;使…指向;把…引向

value.def: If a remark or look is directed at you, someone says something to you or looks at you.

example.ex: She could hardly believe the question was directed towards her...
example.tran: 她很难相信这个问题是冲她来的。

example.ex: The abuse was directed at the TV crews...
example.tran: 这些辱骂是冲着电视台的工作人员来的。

example.ex: Arnold directed a meaningful look at Irma.
example.tran: 阿诺德意味深长地看了艾尔玛一眼。

value.tran: 使(话语或眼神)针对，指向，冲…而来

value.def: If you direct someone somewhere, you tell them how to get there.

example.ex: Could you direct them to Dr Lamont's office, please?...
example.tran: 你能告诉他们去拉蒙特医生的办公室怎么走吗？

example.ex: Inside, a guard directed them to the right.
example.tran: 进去后，一名警卫把他们引向了右边。

value.def: When someone directs a project or a group of people, they are responsible for organizing the people and activities that are involved.

example.ex: Christopher will direct day-to-day operations.
example.tran: 克里斯托弗将管理日常的运营。

example.ex: ...his coolness in directing the rescue of nine hostages.
example.tran: 在组织解救9名人质的过程中他所表现出的冷静

example.ex: Organizations need clear direction...
example.tran: 各组织机构需要条理清晰的指导。

example.ex: The house was built under the direction of John's partner.
example.tran: 这座房子是在约翰的合伙人的指导下盖起来的。

value.def: When someone directs a film, play, or television programme, they are responsible for the way in which it is performed and for telling the actors and assistants what to do.

example.ex: He directed various TV shows...
example.tran: 他执导过多种题材的电视节目。

example.ex: The film was directed by Howard Hawks.
example.tran: 该影片是由霍华德·霍克斯导演的。

example.ex: ...Miss Birkin's long-held ambition to direct as well as act.
example.tran: 伯金小姐既当演员又做导演的夙愿

value.tran: 导演，执导(电影、戏剧或电视节目)

value.def: If you are directed to do something, someone in authority tells you to do it.

example.ex: They have been directed to give special attention to the problem of poverty...
example.tran: 他们得到指示要特别关注贫困问题。

example.ex: The Bishop directed the faithful to stay at home.
example.tran: 主教要求信徒们呆在家中。

value.def: If you are a direct descendant of someone, you are related to them through your parents and your grandparents and so on.

example.ex: She is a direct descendant of Queen Victoria.
example.tran: 她是维多利亚女王的嫡系后代。

trans: 国外直接投资；对外直接投资
直接影响；直接影响技术
近战；直接接触；直接接触电击；直接接觸；孤胆拯救
直接营销(通过邮寄或电话直接向顾客销售产品或推销服务)

partsOfSpeech.dec: cor 加强 + rect 正，直 → 正确的
correct 正确的 + itude 表状态 → 行为端正
cor 加强 + rect 正，直 + ive …的 → 纠正的
di 二 + rect 正，直 → 直接连接两点的 → 直接的
direct 直接的 + ion 表名词 → 直着走下去 → 方向
e 加强 + rect 正，直 → 竖直
erect 直立的 + ion 表名词 → 直立，竖立
in 不 + correct 正确的 → 错误的
rect 正，直 + angle 角 →〔四个角〕都是直角 → 矩形
rect 正，直 + ify 使… → 使…正 → 改正〔错误〕
rect 正，直 + itude 表状态 → 正直；正确
